In progress

Eagle Eyes Scan

I'm working on a research contribution to Eagle Eyes Scan, a piece of software that helps search and rescue teams locate missing persons from aerial imagery. My group and I were tasked to look for ways to improve upon their existing colour-based detection model. Our team decided to use an existing version of their colour-based detection model, and add our own machine-learning layer on top to filter out false positives. Check back here for results!

Coming soon.

JourneyPeers

I'm working with a father of an autistic child. Theres a problem out there. Finding the right services and support staff for your child's needs can often be difficult. We are developing JourneyPeers to help parents find the right people, fast and frictionless.

Snowsoftware Project Management

This project was completed with a team of 11 other classmates. We created a comprehensive project management tool where employees can enter in their timesheets. Employee supervisors can approve timesheets. Project managers can manage their projects in work packages, assign other employees and review project expenditures and trends via reports. Human resources can add/edit employees. The list goes on!

Supertrip

This is a small project I created with my classmates. Its a demo of a daily itinerary planner created with the ASP.NET MVC framework. The goal was to use the GPT language model in some novel way. We decided to create a prompt-based UI, where a user can input a description of their desired trip and the results that appear will account for all of the user's requirements. Users can also register/login to save and edit a list of itineraries by date.

ASP.NET MVC
CSS
GPT 3.5 Turbo
SQLite
JavaScript
Offline for now

Ast-Blaster

Inspired by classic arcade games, I set out to create a simple shooter game to learn WebGL. I imported the PixiJS library and went to town. Although the game's premise is simple, I created a fully featured game application with a back-end scoring and ranking system, functional 2D physics (coded from scratch by yours truly, no library here!), poppy vibrant sounds and a cool retro aesthetic. I am particularly proud of the impact particles that bounce according to the impact vector direction. And they're pretty!

HTML
CSS
JavaScript
PixiJS
node.js
Postgresql
Howler.js
Play!

Brayden's Duck Party

This started out as a simple THREE.js tutorial demo, until I found a 3D model of a duck, then it became a game. This project had me learning Blender to make some simple 3D models. I also had to learn to use Webpack to package together all the THREE.js modules needed. Note the bouncy 3D physics using the CANNON.js library. This game is dedicated to my nephew, who really really loves ducks. Its silly ducky mayhem.

HTML
CSS
JavaScript
THREE.js
Webpack
Offline for now

The Point Roberts Gas App

If you are like me and live in South Delta, you may often wonder whether its worth it to drive to Point Roberts, Washington to buy gas. I made a utility to help me compare prices between Canadian and American fuel in my area. I couldn't find an API for fuel price data, so I made my own. I used the Puppeteer.js library to "scrape" data from Google Maps for gas stations in Ladner, Tsawassen and Point Roberts. The data is saved into a Postgres database. Then I applied the Heroku scheduler to automate daily scraping. The front end is designed to be lightweight and mobile-first, so its accessible when I am out and about. The app also has a desktop mode that uses the Leaflet.js maps library to geographically show the locations of gas stations.

HTML
CSS
JavaScript
node.js
Puppeteer.js
Postgresql
Valet API
Leaflet.js
Offline for now

WeCool (COMP 2800 Project)

As a summer term project, my team and I decided to build a social media app. The goal was to foster a community around staying cool during summer months since hotter temperatures are becoming a serious public health issue. To do so, the app allows users to share timeline posts or events around the premise of staying cool. Using Express-sessions, we built from scratch a complete set of user-features including account creation, user log-in, user profiles with display pictures, timeline posts, and an admin dashboard with full admin control.

HTML
CSS
JavaScript
node.js
Express-sessions
Multer
MySQL
Google Maps API
Offline for now

Checkin (COMP 1800 Project)

For our first term project, my team and I decided to build an attendance-taking app. During the height of the pandemic, venues such as restaurants were required to record your presence for contact tracing. And so, we realized a need for an all-digital attendance-taking solution. Our goal was to create an app that allows any number of attendees to check in to any event quickly without much hassle. With Checkin, users can log in to their accounts to create and manage their events. Attendees of those events can scan a shared QR code which will open up a page on their phones that prompts them for their name and email. Its that simple. This project had us learning Firebase Authentication for user account creation and log in. We also implemented Firestore to store all app data.

HTML
CSS
JavaScript
Firebase
Firestore
